title: Automatic and uniform frame extraction is not uniform, it is random.
body:
I have just extracted frames 3 times from the same video, using the same project, and the same config, only moving the contents of the labelled data folder to a new location between runs so that I can compare the frame numbers of the extracted frames. The issue is that the extracted frames are non-uniformly spaced throughout the video, and differ each time I run extract_frames(). My guess is that this is because [the Index argument passed to UniformFramesCV2 is None by default](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/cd4f2f558424ed26e4b431097db1ced607c9adc9/deeplabcut/utils/frameselectiontools.py#L80), and not set correctly [when the function is called in extract_frames](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/cd4f2f558424ed26e4b431097db1ced607c9adc9/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/frame_extraction.py#L258). When extracting, I used the following code: `deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path, mode='automatic', algo='uniform', userfeedback=False, crop=False) grabs unique frame numbers each time. ` **Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):** - OS: MacOS 10.15.7 (Catalina) - DeepLabCut Version 2.1.8.2 - DeepLabCut mode: single animal tracking **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior, i.e.: 1. Create a project. 2. Extract frames using the auto/uniform setting. 3. Copy the extracted frames to a new directory. 4. Repeat the frame extraction and compare frame numbers.
